subject: Climate & Environment
title: Seed Banks and Genetic Rescue
description: A micro-lesson that makes Seed Banks and Genetic Rescue usable.

hook.text: Deep inside an Arctic mountain, a vault holds seeds from nearly every food crop on Earth.

buildup.text: The Svalbard Global Seed Vault stores over 1.3 million seed samples from around the world.

discovery.text: Seed banks preserve genetic diversity that could save crops from future diseases or climate shifts.

twist.text: Syria's gene bank was destroyed in war. Svalbard's backup allowed them to rebuild it entirely.

climax.text: Frozen zoos now store DNA, sperm, and embryos of endangered animals for possible future revival.

punchline.text: Saving seeds today is insurance against disasters we can't yet imagine.

quiz.question: What is stored in the Svalbard Global Seed Vault?
options: Seeds from nearly every food crop on Earth
